item.title: Satisfactory Multiplayer: The Basics For Peer-to-Peer And Dedicated Server Hosting
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Factory production lines in Satisfactory will grow to immense sizes the longer you play, and it can be hard to manage. A good friend, though, will cut that work in half. Satisfactory offers both peer-to-peer multiplayer and server-based multiplayer, and each of them has their disadvantages. We'll talk about how to get each of them going here.

There are three ways to host games in Satisfactory: Peer-to-peer games, self-hosted servers and rented servers. Peer-to-peer and self-hosted server options are both free, while a rented server option will have a monthly cost associated with it. Meanwhile, peer-to-peer is the easiest to set up, followed by rented servers, and finally self-hosted servers.

Peer-to-peer

A peer-to-peer session has to be initiated by whoever has the save game you're playing in. Sessions can be private, meaning that you'll need an in-game invite to join, or set to Friends Only, meaning that anyone on your friend list can hop in via Satisfactory's Join Game menu. Each game has a Session ID. If you share this with someone, they can join a Friends Only game regardless of whether they're on your friends list. Each time you initiate a session, though, the Session ID will be reset.

This is, by far, the simplest option, and will be sufficient for most players, but it assumes your schedules will line up enough that the host can always be on when you feel like playing.

Self-Hosted Dedicated Server

A self-hosted dedicated server is something you set up on a computer you have access to, and leave it to run indefinitely, allowing multiple users to join it whenever they wish. The software itself is free, and comes with the game. This is the most complex option in terms of setup and maintenance, and you'll want to refer to the Satisfactory wiki on Dedicated Servers for the details--it's more than we can reasonably go into here. Your ability to do this can also depend on hosting rules set by your internet service provider, meaning that depending on who supplies your internet connection, this may not even be an option at all.

If you have the know-how or the patience, this option will give you the most freedom at the lowest price.

Rented Dedicated Server

A rented dedicated server gives you all the freedom of a self-hosted server, but on someone else's hardware. Most people don't just have a computer that sits around left on and unused all the time that they can set a server up on, so this is going to be a better option for most than the self-hosted option. You have a lot of set-up options, so it will take some patience to set up, but if you have a few friends with different schedules who want to play together, this is a great option. Hosting starts at around $10 a month, though reliable and performant hosting will likely be closer to $15. The more people you intend to have playing, the more important that will be. We're not going to call out any specific providers here, but there are many, many options out there through your favorite search engine.

This option is expensive, but is ideal for a group with multiple players who don't mind pitching in a few dollars to keep things going.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/satisfactory-multiplayer-the-basics-for-peer-to-peer-and-dedicated-server-hosting/1100-6537149/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: All The Forge Armor and Recipes Guide
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Forge has one of the deepest crafting experiences you will find in any of the most popular games in Roblox. You are able to not only find ore throughout the world, but you are then able to take it and create gear to use for battles against zombies and more. There are so many different armor recipes you are able to craft in The Forge.

The general idea for how to craft in The Forge is pretty simple. You mine the ore using your pickaxe and then take it to the titular forge to create gear using a couple of enjoyable minigames. Depending on how many pieces of ore you use and what types they are, you will get various gear. If you want to know how to make all of the armor recipes in The Forge Roblox, check below.

The Forge All Light Armor Recipes

Light armor is the most basic type of armor you can make in The Forge. It is also the easiest, but you won’t get nearly any of the protection that the other armor types offer. That said, for beginners, light armor is what you want to start with.

In general, unless you are using a specific type of armor recipe, the ore type doesn’t matter all that much. Instead, it is all about how many pieces of ore you use. Fortunately, you don’t need many at all to make light armor.

Here are all of the light armor recipes that are available in The Forge and how to make them:

  • Light Helmet: 1 in 1 chance of crafting with 3 ores of any kind
  • Light Leggings: 1 in 2 chance of crafting with 7 or more pieces of ore
  • Light Chestplate: 1 in 3 chance of crafting using roughly 10 pieces of ore

The Forge All Medium Armor Recipes

Medium armor is where the boosts to your stats and the money you can make from selling starts to really kick off. This is the intermediate type of armor that you should focus on once you get past the tutorial of The Forge.

Here are all of the medium armor recipes that are available currently in The Forge:

  • Medium Helmet: 1 in 1 chance of crafting when using more than 10 pieces of ore but less than 17
  • Medium Leggings: 1 in 2 chance of crafting when using more than 17 pieces of ore
  • Medium Chestplate: 1 in 3 chance of crafting when using 17 or more pieces of ore

The Forge All Heavy Armor Recipes

Heavy armor, also known as knight armor, is for the players who are trying to get the most out of their ore. As you might expect, this has some of the highest stats in the game and sell price, but it has harsh requirements at the same time.

Here is how to make all of the heavy armor recipes in this Roblox experience:

  • Knight Helmet: 1 in 1 chance when crafting with roughly 30-35 pieces of ore
  • Knight Leggings: 1 in 2 chance when crafting with 35 or more pieces of ore
  • Knight Chestplate: 1 in 3 chance when crafting with roughly 35 or more pieces of ore

The Forge All Special Armor Recipes

There are special versions of the medium and heavy armor sets that you are able to make. They are generally better than their base versions, but they require highly specific sets of ore to make them.

Here is how to make the Samurai version of the medium armor set:

  • Samurai Helmet: 1 in 2 chance of crafting with 3 Eyes Ore, 3 Obsidian Ore, 3 Uranium Ore, and 7 Mythril Ore
  • Samurai Leggings: 1 in 2 chance of crafting with 2 Eye Ore, 5 Obsidian Ore, 5 Uranium Ore, and 5 Mythril Ore
  • Samurai Chestplate: 1 in 2 chance of crafting with 2 Eye Ore, 5 Obsidian Ore, 5 Uranium Ore, and 5 Mythril Ore

Dark Knight armor, on the other hand, is a special version of the heavy armor set. It, too, has special requirements for how to make it:

  • Dark Knight Helmet: 1 in 2 chance when crafting with 2 Demonite Ore, 3 Eye Ore, 3 Mythril Ore, 6 Obsidian Ore, and 6 Uranium Ore
  • Dark Knight Leggings: 1 in 2 chance when crafting with approximately 10 Demonite Ore, 2 Eye Ore, 8 Mythril Ore, 9 Obsidian Ore, and 9 Uranium Ore
  • Dark Knight Chestplate: 1 in 2 chance when crafting with approximately 8 Demonite Ore, 5 Eye Ore, 8 Mythril Ore, 8 Obsidian Ore, and 8 Uranium Ore

There is so much to see and do in Roblox The Forge, so the thrills don’t end with the main quests. You should find out the current codes available in The Forge, so you don’t miss out on any free goodies and the tier list for what items are most worth using.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/all-the-forge-armor-and-recipes-guide/1100-6537172/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f
